title: New class wizard doesn't set the context correctly for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard in build 20011106 with a .java file open in the editor, the 'Enclosing Type' field is blank when it should default to the current type in the editor.
OB: The 'Enclosing Type' field is blank when trying to create a new nested class.
EB: The 'Enclosing Type' field should automatically default to the current type in the editor.
SR: To reproduce the issue in build 20011106: 1. Open a .java file in the editor. 2. Click on the 'New class' button. 3. Check the 'Enclosing Type' field. It should be blank, but it should default to the current type in the editor.
